attributes.comment:
I have just learned of the proposed increases to fees related to adoption. I am in
the process of adopting a child from China. I sincerely ask that you take into
consideration the following points before passing this increase:
1) Many adoptive parents are now having to submit the I600A more than once
during the adoption process - This is due to lengthening waiting times from the
original submittal of the paperwork to the country of origin and the time of actual
adoption. This means adopting parents will have to pay this fee TWICE (since the
document expires after 18 months). This is a very large sum of money for many
of us.
2) Because of the 100% likelihood that we will have to file the I600A again,
perhaps you can put a discounted fee in place for those of us who are filing a 2nd
(or possibly 3rd) time for the same adoption. This would be greatly appreciated.
3) While I understand economics/inflation and how it affects the cost of doing
business, the adoption-related fees proposed are exponentially higher! I can
comprehend a slightly higher "market adjustment" if fees have not been increased
for many years, but USCIS has increased its fees regularly over the years. I ask
that you reconsider such a drastic increase.
4) The petitions and related fee increases that will directly impact us are: I600A, N-
565 and N-600. The 1600A fee is nearly 20% higher. The N-565 and N-600 both
have proposed % increases of over 40%.

My husband and I budgeted for slightly more than what we expected to pay in
fees, etc - but this is MUCH greater than we would have ever anticipated.

Thank you, in advance, for your consideration of these points.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
